body:
It seems the java and c++ protos are using different package names, which
may cause the problem.
For a quick workaround, you can try to use the same string as package name
in
https://github.com/grpc/grpc-java/blob/master/examples/src/main/proto/route_guide.proto
and
https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/examples/protos/route_guide.proto
to see whether that works.

On Mon, Aug 31, 2015 at 12:50 AM, garygogo notifications@github.com wrote:

> I used "grpc/examples/cpp/route_guide" as a server and
> "grpc-java/examples/src/main/java/io/grpc/examples/routeguide" as a client,
> port is 50051;
> I got error as follow:
> 
> com.google.common.util.concurrent.UncheckedExecutionException:
> io.grpc.StatusRuntimeException: UNIMPLEMENTED
> at io.grpc.stub.Calls.getUnchecked(Calls.java:117)
> at io.grpc.stub.Calls.blockingUnaryCall(Calls.java:129)
> at
> io.grpc.examples.routeguide.RouteGuideGrpc$RouteGuideBlockingStub.getFeature(RouteGuideGrpc.java:204)
> at
> io.grpc.examples.routeguide.RouteGuideClient.getFeature(RouteGuideClient.java:81)
> at
> io.grpc.examples.routeguide.RouteGuideClient.main(RouteGuideClient.java:233)
> Caused by: io.grpc.StatusRuntimeException: UNIMPLEMENTED
> at io.grpc.Status.asRuntimeException(Status.java:428)
> at io.grpc.stub.Calls$UnaryStreamToFuture.onClose(Calls.java:324)
> at
> io.grpc.ChannelImpl$CallImpl$ClientStreamListenerImpl$3.run(ChannelImpl.java:402)
> at io.grpc.SerializingExecutor$TaskRunner.run(SerializingExecutor.java:154)
> at
> java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
> at
> java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
> at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
> 
> Exception in thread "main"
> com.google.common.util.concurrent.UncheckedExecutionException:
> io.grpc.StatusRuntimeException: UNIMPLEMENTED
> at io.grpc.stub.Calls.getUnchecked(Calls.java:117)
> at io.grpc.stub.Calls.blockingUnaryCall(Calls.java:129)
> at
> io.grpc.examples.routeguide.RouteGuideGrpc$RouteGuideBlockingStub.getFeature(RouteGuideGrpc.java:204)
> at
> io.grpc.examples.routeguide.RouteGuideClient.getFeature(RouteGuideClient.java:81)
> at
> io.grpc.examples.routeguide.RouteGuideClient.main(RouteGuideClient.java:233)
> Caused by: io.grpc.StatusRuntimeException: UNIMPLEMENTED
> at io.grpc.Status.asRuntimeException(Status.java:428)
> at io.grpc.stub.Calls$UnaryStreamToFuture.onClose(Calls.java:324)
> at
> io.grpc.ChannelImpl$CallImpl$ClientStreamListenerImpl$3.run(ChannelImpl.java:402)
> at io.grpc.SerializingExecutor$TaskRunner.run(SerializingExecutor.java:154)
> at
> java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
> at
> java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
> at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
> 
> can grpc support do like this?
> 
> ‚Äî
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/3151.

https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/3161 and https://github.com/grpc/grpc-go/issues/321 are created to use the same package name everywhere. Back to your question, all languages should be able to interop with all others. Thanks for reporting the issue.
yeah, it works,thank you very much.
Thanks @yang-g and @garygogo . We have the similar issue because the proto files from server have upgrade. This helps a lot üëç
